reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fans of Spain's Paradors count on high quality lodging in a unique location. Back in the day, the Parador likely was the best hotel in Jaen. Today, the Parador shows its age, but still provides a unique experience.
reviews.title: Classic Parador

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The drive up the narrow road to the top of the hill shows guests that they will be well above the noise and bustle of the city. The spectacular views start in the parking area, previewing sublime scenes overlooking the city and the surrounding mountains. The building entrance and reception further suggest a sense of refuge,, as guests pass through thick walls recalling the fortresses that once guarded the region.
reviews.title: Charming, with great view

reviews.text: Check in took minutes, and the receptionist accompanied us to the parking lot help transport luggage to the room. This task would have been difficult without assistance, as the inclined lot and several ramps in the parador halls confirm that the place was constructed before many accessibility allowances were built into hotels.
reviews.title: Remarkable 18th century castle now a lovely parador.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Decor and furnishings are decidedly medival, further reminders of the building's history. Our double room had tile floors, softened somewhat by rugs at bed side. We noticed that parts of the floor were heated, which also increased the comfort on a chilly night. The bed was comfortable, with high quality linen. We spent a perfectly quiet night, with little noise from the hall or other rooms. The bathroom was spotless, but years of spray from the shower has deteriorated wood moldings around the floor. This cosmetic detail seemed like a small matter, and our only other disappointment was the weak wi-fi signal in the room. We had to go to the guest lounge for reliable internet access.
reviews.title: Great View
Jaen - absolutely magnificent
reviews.text: The restaurant provides a typical parador menu, with classic regional dishes that are prepared at a high level. Service is formal and professional. Guess who have dined in many parador restaurants might tire of the offerings, but the dining room certainly is a good option for travelers who don't wish to drive down to the city. Once you get up the hill, you might as well stay for as long as you can.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The road up to the castle is long and winding but rewarding when you reach the top. The reception is a bit reserved, but at least they help to carry the baggage from the reception to the room. Our room was beautiful, with a balcony with a splendid view of the surrounding mountains, we could enjoy the sunset. Bed was very comfortable, everything was in good condition. You really have the feeling to be in a medieval castle when you walk through the building, but it is partially renovated of course. Had a nice dinner and breakfast at the Restaurant, good quality good. Staff friendly. There is a public part of the castle (opening times) which is authentic and partially in ruins, and offers excellent views over Jaén and the lands below. Also note the dungeon that is quite depressing to imagine human beings were kept in there.
reviews.title: Castle at unique location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I recently stayed a night in the parador. The hotel occupies a fantastic position right next door to the Castillo De Santa Catalina, on top of a hill above the city of Jaen. The hotel itself, albeit constructed in the style of a medieval castle is actually fairly modern. This is in no way a critisism, as it enables the hotel to provide modern facilities which probably would not be possible in an original. Our room, which I think was one of the simpler rooms was of a reasonable size, had a spacious bathroom, with power shower and also had mini bar, satelite tv etc. The usual facilities provided in a modern hotel. We had a wonderful meal, in the restaurant, mine a beatifully cooked Sea Bream, my wifes a vegetarian Cannaloni, We finished with a selection of fruit sorbets. We had a lovely bottle of wine and a couple of extra glasses and I think our bill came to around 55 euros. Fantastic value for the quality of food and wine. Also the restaurant is stunning, having the feel of a medieval banqueting room.
reviews.title: Great hotel for a short city break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Jaen itself does not hold much to attract the visitor apart from an impressive Cathedral and the Arab baths ( closed for refurbishment during our stay).
reviews.title: Fantastic Moorish Castle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We walked into the town on a footpath that leads through the forest on the hillside above the city. It is a fairly easy walk and took no more than about half an hour. We even walked back up, which again wasn't too strenous.
reviews.title: Excellent location.

reviews.text: Over all I would recommend this hotel for a short stay of 1-2 days.
reviews.title: spectacular view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent one night at this parador, thinking it would be the best night on our 3 week trip. Yes, the views are gorgeous, but the parador itself seemed generic and excessively overpriced for what you got. Our dining experience was laughable... our server was very rude, the food seemed like it had been frozen for 6 months then partially reheated, the vibe there was generally very strange (they were playing a muzak version of the Twin Peaks theme song while we were eating...), our expensive cheese tasted like plastic, there were olive pits (leftover from other patrons) in our bowl of olives, and it was by far the most expensive dinner of our entire trip.
reviews.title: Worst, most overpriced place in Andalucia

reviews.text: Our room smelled of disinfectant (probably due to their disinfecting program - see photo), and it was very hard to ignore. There was mold in the bathroom... again, not worth the price tag.
reviews.title: Chance to stay in a castle!
The views!
reviews.text: The pool (which we hoped would give us a break from the disappointment) was surrounded by a fortress of glass and plastic and the lifeguard was talking incredibly loudly into her cell phone for the 2 hours that we spent poolside. Not a moment of peace & quiet.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beyond all that, we felt like the parador system itself ripped us off. Conceptually, it seems like a good idea, but in reality we found it very disappointing. There was an error in our reservation (somehow the system booked us in a different city one month earlier) and they refused to credit or refund us. Like I said, very disappointing.
reviews.title: Amazing place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Here's your chance to say in a castle! Quite a sight to see as you drive into Jaen and seeing the castle lit on top of the hill.
reviews.title: A night in a castle: feel like a knight

reviews.text: This was only our second stay in a Parador and it was an excellent location for a day trip to Granada to visit the Alhambra. The setting on top of the hill is spectacular and, despite the parador being a modern extension to the castle walls, it does give you that castle experience. Dinner was excellent in a formal dining room. Although we had booked using a 5-night card it was still expensive considering that there were two supplements (one for a superior room - the only one available (?) when we reserved 6 months ahead.). All in all, well worth the visit.
reviews.title: A castle for the night - with a view

reviews.text: The Parador is an hotel perched on the hill above the town. It is 5-star accommodation at reasonable price. The old castle has been faithfully and tastefully restored. The rooms are spacious and well-equipped and includes wi-fi free in the lobby. Most hotels charge for internet connections which is a rip-off as it costs them nothing so the parador system got the thumbs up from me. The food was excellent but as I found on a previous trip, there is nothing in the town in the way of restaurants. Jaen is a great stop-off on the way to Andalucia and the Parador is a five-star with all of the trappings.
reviews.title: Stay at the Parador - not in the town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A classic parador, built inside an old castle, with wonderful views of the town and incredible dining room/bar area. Excellent breakfast (included churros). As well as the buffet, you can ask for eggs cooked to your liking. My only complaint was that it was very windy at night, and there was rattling from a loose window pane. I complained about this the following morning, and although someone came to look at this, it was never fixed.
reviews.title: Spectacular castle setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed one night on a recent touring trip around Andalusia and were very well received by the staff who upgraded us to the Royal room in the tower with a 4 poster bed and huge terace with wonderful views of the countryside below and quickly provide feather pillows when requested. The furnishings in this very impressive parador are a little tired and the bathrooms do need complete refurbishing as the tiles are stained and some cracked and there was only a shower over the bath and no bathgowns, slippers etc. Unfortunately the terrace areas for coffee and bar overlook the car park instead of the other side of the building which would be much nicer. The public rooms are rather too big as you might expect in a castle and intimate corners are a bit lacking. A new look by an architect and an interior designer could make this into a very spectacular hotel. Staff were very pleasant, breakfast was good and plentiful and the evening meal was a good regional menu at the same rate as most other paradors in the region. Don't bother to spend too much time in the town itself as it is very poor and rundown although the Arab baths in a very interesting museum (free) were worth a visit. I would recommend one night here for the location at least. Garden and swimming pool were being renovated when we were there and whole area looked rather run down.
reviews.title: Unbeatable location in a castle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great parador which gave tremendous views of the surrounding area. Also the bar area and lounge area were beautiful and felt like a "palace". It is a bit far from the centre of Jaenm so you cant really wander by foot
reviews.title: Fantastic views and building
